title: How to Request a Refund
content:
If you need to request a refund for your EventHub purchase, follow these steps:

1. Navigate to your EventHub account on the website or app.
2. Locate the order you'd like to cancel in your order history.
3. Click 'Request Refund' next to the order.
4. Choose a reason for the refund request and submit the form.

Important notes:
- Refunds are processed within 7 business days, and you will be notified via email when the refund is complete.
- EventHub's refund policy applies to cancellations made within the 24-hour window before the event start time.
- Ticket insurance can be added during checkout to extend refund eligibility.

Contact us:
If you have any questions or issues with your refund, please contact our customer support team at support@eventhub.com.

title: App Crashes When Opening Tickets: Solutions
content:
If the EventHub app crashes when you try to open your tickets, follow these steps to troubleshoot the issue:

1. Check for app updates. Make sure that you're using the latest version of the EventHub app. Updates often include bug fixes and performance improvements that can resolve crashing issues.

2. Restart your device. Sometimes, a simple restart can resolve crashing issues. Press and hold the power button until the 'Slide to Power Off' option appears, then slide the power icon to the right to turn off your device. Wait a few moments, then press and hold the power button again to turn it back on.

3. Clear the EventHub app cache. Clearing the app cache can help resolve crashing issues. Go to your device's settings, find the 'Apps' or 'Application Manager' section, select 'EventHub', and tap 'Clear Cache'.

4. Reinstall the EventHub app. If none of the above steps resolve the issue, try uninstalling and then reinstalling the EventHub app.

Important notes: If the issue persists, contact our support team at support@eventhub.com for further assistance.

Contact information: For additional assistance, contact our support team at support@eventhub.com or call us at 1-800-EVENTHUB.

title: Payment Declined During Checkout: Solutions
content:
If you've experienced a payment decline during EventHub checkout, follow these steps to resolve the issue:

1. Check your payment information. Make sure that your credit card information is correct, including the card number, expiration date, and security code.

2. Check your billing address. Ensure that the billing address you entered matches the address associated with your credit card account.

3. Contact your bank or credit card issuer. Sometimes, a payment decline can be due to your bank or credit card issuer flagging the purchase as suspicious. Contact them to confirm that the charge is valid and to request that they authorize the transaction.

4. Try a different payment method. If the issue persists, try using a different payment method, such as a different credit card or PayPal.

Important notes: If you're still experiencing issues, contact our support team at support@eventhub.com for assistance.

Contact information: For additional assistance, contact our support team at support@eventhub.com or call us at 1-800-EVENTHUB.

1. Check your spam folder: Sometimes, confirmation emails end up in your spam or junk folder. Check these folders to see if the email is there.

2. Contact the event organizer: The event organizer may have sent the confirmation email directly to your email address. Check with them to see if they can resend the email.

3. Check your order history on EventHub: Log in to your EventHub account and check your order history. The confirmation email contains a link to your tickets, which you can access directly from your account.

4. Request a resend: If none of the above steps work, contact our support team at support@eventhub.com to request a resend of the confirmation email.

Important notes:
- Allow up to 1 hour for the confirmation email to arrive.
- If you've recently purchased multiple tickets, the confirmation email may contain multiple attachments.
- If you've created a new email address since purchasing, make sure you're using the correct email address to log in to your EventHub account.
